name: remerge
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to combine or join together again, or to cause things to do this: The two departments will probably remerge in the future. It is planned that the colleges will be remerged, probably next year. I forgot to remerge the two files before I ran the program.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are plans to re-merge the two departments that were split up eight years ago.The firm was originally a spin-off from a large drug company and later re-merged with its parent.The river splits into two here, but the channels remerge a mile downstream.
